intro: Socratina bemarivensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or white, followed by follicles containing seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
